meanings.definition: A small projection or ledge that can be grasped by the fingers for support or leverage.
meanings.sent1: The climber found a secure fingerhold on the rock face.
meanings.sent2: She reached for a fingerhold to steady herself on the ladder.
meanings.sent3: The tiny mouse used the fingerhold on the branch like a gymnast on a balance beam.
meanings.sent4: His determination was the only fingerhold he had in the difficult situation.
meanings.sent5: The fingerhold on the cliff edge saved her from falling.

meanings.definition: To grip or hold onto something with the fingers.
meanings.sent1: He had to fingerhold the slippery rope to climb up.
meanings.sent2: She fingerholds the pen tightly while writing her name.
meanings.sent3: The toddler tried to fingerhold the soap in the bath but kept dropping it.
meanings.sent4: In the dark cave, he fingerheld onto his flashlight for dear life.
meanings.sent5: She fingerholds onto her memories like precious treasures.
